org.biolegato.sequence.canvas

Interface SequenceCanvasObject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SequenceList, SequenceTextArea

    public interface SequenceCanvasObject
    An interface for abstracting the two canvas objects (SequenceTextArea and SequenceList) within BioLegato's Sequence canvas. This is useful for streamlining access to both, especially when using Sequence canvas specific menu commands, which alter the currently selected sequence.
    Author:
    Graham Alvare, Brian Fristensky

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeCase()
      Changes the case of the currently selected sequence.
      void deleteSelection()
      Cuts/deletes the content selected in the sequence canvas object.
      void readIn(DataFormat format, java.util.Scanner source, boolean overwrite)
      Reads contents into the current sequence canvas object.
      void writeOut(DataFormat format, java.lang.Appendable dest)
      Writes the current contents of the canvas object to an Appendable object.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteSelection

        void deleteSelection()
        Cuts/deletes the content selected in the sequence canvas object.

      • writeOut

        void writeOut(DataFormat format,
              java.lang.Appendable dest)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the current contents of the canvas object to an Appendable object.
        Parameters:
        format - the format to write the data in.
        dest - the destination Appendable object to write the data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IOException if there is any error appending the data to the Appendable object.

      • readIn

        void readIn(DataFormat format,
            java.util.Scanner source,
            boolean overwrite)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads contents into the current sequence canvas object.
        Parameters:
        format - the file format to write the data in.
        source - the data source to read data from.
        overwrite - whether to overwrite the data currently selected in the canvas object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IOException if there is any error reading data from the Scanner object.

      • changeCase

        void changeCase()
        Changes the case of the currently selected sequence. If the sequence is of inconsistent case, the case of the first character as the case of the sequence, for case conversion. For example:

        xYzJWwa23 --- will become ---> WYZJWWA23
